text: Vote your review of: 2020 :middle_finger: , or :thumbsup:, choose one

, or

text: 0/10 do not reccomend

elements.text: 0/10 do not reccomend

text: ppl saying "2020 gonna be remembered", me: "I can't forget this @#!% fast enough" :face_palm:

elements.text: ppl saying "2020 gonna be remembered", me: "I can't forget this @#!% fast enough"

text: I will have PTSD from 2020 until the day I die (which hopefully won’t be in 2021, waiting to be able to get the vaccine!)

elements.text: I will have PTSD from 2020 until the day I die (which hopefully won’t be in 2021, waiting to be able to get the vaccine!)

text: I'm extremely fortunate to have been able to work from home and scored a new, better job in Perth, which has been COVID-free for several months now. I can't complain

elements.text: I'm extremely fortunate to have been able to work from home and scored a new, better job in Perth, which has been COVID-free for several months now. I can't complain

text: I got a better job this year too - super blessed - but worth mentioning... I needed to leave my former workplace for my own sanity, and relocating halfway across the US during a pandemic was stressful as hell.

elements.text: I got a better job this year too - super blessed - but worth mentioning... I needed to leave my former workplace for my own sanity, and relocating halfway across the US during a pandemic was stressful as hell.

text: <@U01GNU6Q32M> same here :flag-nz:

elements.text: same here

text: Agree. Even here in Australia where things are relatively under control, it's been extremely stressful due to the pandemic. Moving is bad enough, but throw in a move all the way across the country and it gets worse

elements.text: Agree. Even here in Australia where things are relatively under control, it's been extremely stressful due to the pandemic. Moving is bad enough, but throw in a move all the way across the country and it gets worse

text: I've been fortunate. 2020 was tolerable. My major concern is ensuring my 98 year old father stays healthy. I used to fly to Atlanta about once a month. I now drive 10 hours each way. The vaccine can't come soon enough.

elements.text: I've been fortunate. 2020 was tolerable. My major concern is ensuring my 98 year old father stays healthy. I used to fly to Atlanta about once a month. I now drive 10 hours each way. The vaccine can't come soon enough.

text: That's a long drive Paul, but anything for family. My wife has immune issues so we are basically treating COVID like a hospital trip/death sentence even though for all we know she would be fine. The good thing is, we live together so it makes things a lot easier.

elements.text: That's a long drive Paul, but anything for family. My wife has immune issues so we are basically treating COVID like a hospital trip/death sentence even though for all we know she would be fine. The good thing is, we live together so it makes things a lot easier.

text: I really don’t understand why anyone would give a thumbs up :+1: to 2020!  Please explain, those who did!

elements.text: I really don’t understand why anyone would give a thumbs up
to 2020!  Please explain, those who did!

text: Yea what Scott said!

elements.text: Yea what Scott said!

text: <@U014LRLJXRP> Why did you give 2020 a thumbs up? Also <@U6C5KSWAC> Something great must have happened to each of you, to make up for all the sh*t that happened last year!

elements.text: Why did you give 2020 a thumbs up? Also
Something great must have happened to each of you, to make up for all the sh*t that happened last year!

text: <@UB7JS9CHF> not gonna go into details but despite the pandemic 2020 was better than the last few years before for me

elements.text: not gonna go into details but despite the pandemic 2020 was better than the last few years before for me

text: Well, then I’m glad to hear that it was at least better for someone! I do hope that it continues on an upwards trend for you!

elements.text: Well, then I’m glad to hear that it was at least better for someone! I do hope that it continues on an upwards trend for you!

text: <@UB7JS9CHF> I live in New Zealand.  Despite a brief lockdown, things were largely undisturbed, so I have been very lucky.  Also, I finished my degree this year :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: I live in New Zealand.  Despite a brief lockdown, things were largely undisturbed, so I have been very lucky.  Also, I finished my degree this year

text: Oh, you *are* lucky! (And, the Kiwis were smart about who they chose to lead them, something I can’t say about the US, UK, or Brazil - all places I’ve lived :cry:)

are
lucky! (And, the Kiwis were smart about who they chose to lead them, something I can’t say about the US, UK, or Brazil - all places I’ve lived

text: Congrats on finishing the degree - are you Dr. Jake now?

elements.text: Congrats on finishing the degree - are you Dr. Jake now?

text: No no---it’s just a BSc, nothing fancy!!
